component.name: CRUSH
component.summary: CRUSH is a data reduction and imaging pipeline for select astronomical cameras

description.p: CRUSH is an astronomical data reduction/imaging tool for certain astronomical cameras. Currently, it supports SHARC-2, LABOCA, SABOCA, PolKa, GISMO, SCUBA-2, SOFIA/HAWC+, and SOFIA/HIRMES.
CRUSH is written entirely in Java, allowing it to run on virtually any platform. It is normally run from the command-line with several arguments.
Further documentation and additional distribution formats are available from the CRUSH website.
The main highlights of the CRUSH 2.50-1:

ul.li: Dropped support for: ASZCa, p-ArTeMiS, MAKO, MAKO-2, SHARC, and MUSTANG-2
New API for running CRUSH from inside a Java application
Complete overhaul of pixel layout handling and simplified class hierarchy
Improved Fourier filtering with support for varied channel beam sizes
Fixes to channel lookup duplicate IDs with off-by-one indexing
Improved/fixed telescope motion processing, stats, and flagging
Continued developmet for SOFIA/HIRMES, with v.9 simulation support
Many under the hood architecture improvements
